parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The extended stopping distance can increase the risk of accidents, injuries, and fatalities, as the vehicle takes longer to come to a stop, potentially leading to rear-end collisions or other crashes.
symptoms: The vehicle takes longer than expected to stop
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal travels further than usual before the vehicle starts to slow down
the vehicle does not slow down as expected when the brake is applied.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Front Passenger Seat Belt Self-Tightening Issue
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The self-tightening of the front passenger seat belt can cause discomfort, distraction, and potentially lead to accidents due to the sudden and unexpected tightening of the belt.
symptoms: The front passenger seat belt gradually becomes tighter and tighter until it must be removed
the belt does not loosen after initial tightening.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Drive Belt Slippage in Wet Weather
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The drive belt slippage in wet weather can cause the vehicle to lose power and control, leading to accidents and potential harm to occupants and other road users.
symptoms: The drive belt slips off or loses traction in wet weather conditions
causing the vehicle to lose power

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inadequate design of the drive belt can lead to frequent failures, causing inconvenience, expense, and potential safety risks.
symptoms: and may cause the vehicle to lose power or stall.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Seat Belt Design and Booster Seat Regulations
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The inadequate design of the seat belt and the changing regulations regarding booster seat usage can lead to a higher risk of injury or fatality in the event of an accident, particularly for children and shorter adults.
symptoms: The seat belt crosses the stomach instead of the hips

causing discomfort and potentially leading to internal injuries in the event of a crash. Children and shorter adults may be at risk of head trauma due to the proximity of their heads to the ceiling of the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The insufficient head clearance in minivans can lead to a higher risk of head trauma or concussion in the event of an accident, particularly for children and shorter adults.
symptoms: Children and shorter adults may hit their heads on the ceiling of the vehicle in the event of a sudden stop or accident

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Driver-Side Shock Tower Rusting and Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The rusting and failure of the driver-side shock tower can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities, especially if failure occurs at high speeds.
symptoms: Rust or corrosion on the driver-side shock tower

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Manufacturing Defect in Shock Tower Design
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The defective design of the shock tower can lead to premature rusting and failure, causing loss of vehicle control, accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: Rust or corrosion on the driver-side shock tower
